alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 1:25PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT/530 PM EDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in southeast Alabama, Henry and Houston. In southwest Georgia, Early. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT /530 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 125 PM CDT /225 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Headland, Dothan, Taylor, Kinsey, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Avon, Newville, Gordon, Haleburg, Tumbleton, Balkum, Dancey, Grandberry Crossroads and Headland Municipal A/P. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
